post.summary: Public API for someone to request OTP on email for registration, verifying email

CustomerDefsTenancy.title:
- Dedicated: dedicated tenancy customer
typically assigned for Orgs requiring user management
with custom SSO integrations, requiring extra security
controls
 - Shared: Shared tenancy customer
typically assigned for individuals or group of
individuals, where users can authenticate using public
SSO and authz can be managed by admins

CustomerUpdateCustomerBody.title: request for update of an existing customer

name.title: display name for the org unit

OrgUnitUpdateOrgUnitBody.title: request for update of an existing org unit

OrgUnitUserAddOrgUnitUserBody.title: org unit user role add request

OrgUnitUserUpdateOrgUnitUserBody.title: org unit user role update request

name.title:
key id will be allocated by virtue of key creation
user is expected to provide an optional name for
ease of reference, it is recommended to be unique
but not validated or ensured to be unique

validity.title:
validity of the api key, tenure in seconds for
which this api key is being created
when not set or 0 it means key with no expiry

name.title: name of the api key provided by the creator

id.title:
ID of the access key that will be used by the
client and server to identify ApiKey in use

status.title: current status of the Api Key

lastUsed.title: timestamp when the api key was used last time

created.title: timestamp when the api key was created

expireAt.title: timestamp when the api key will expire

secret.title:
Secret to be used in conjunction with key id
for authentication of client using the api key
but typically the auth mechanism used will not
expect to share this secret ever on the wire
after it is being created, neither on APIs nor
for authentication

apiApiKeyDefStatus.title:
- Active: ApiKey is active
 - Expired: ApiKey has expired
 - Disabled: ApiKey is disabled
